pullRequest.title: Trying to add prometheus handler automatically
pullRequest.bodyText: I confirm that this contribution is made under the terms of the license found in the root directory of this repository's source tree and that I have the authority necessary to make this contribution on behalf of its copyright owner.

commit.message: Trying to add prometheus handler automatically
Added correct handler for Prometheus requests
Returning with correct format. Dependencies broken
Cleaning up configs, testing is not working

nodes.bodyText: This file was probably not meant to be committed?
Please rename to PrometheusV1Handler. Not including the version in some of the other handlers was a mistake from my side.
There is no need for a separate port for the prometheus api.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4,3 +4,6 @@ namespace=container.handler.metrics
 
 metricsPort int
 metricsApiPath string
+
+prometheusPort int

nodes.bodyText: I suggest to use a prometheus specific test file, even though this handler should just directly output the data it gets from the metrics-proxy. (The output from the ApplicationMetricsHandler in the real world should be the metrics for all nodes in prometheus format.)
Un-ignore when test file is added
You can probably remove this method and use the one in MetricsV2HandlerTest, after making it package private. Less code duplication.
I suggest to rename to METRICS_V1_PATH for consistency.
Same here, suggest to use PROMETHEUS_V1_PATH
You can add a static import of the toPrometheusModel, as the class name does not add any extra value, just extra characters.
toMetricsPackets can also be static imported.
I think this can be package-private.

commit.message: Fixed minor naming errors and throws
